descriptors.name: StandardizedRfTesting
descriptors.label: Zigbee - SoC StandardizedRfTesting
descriptors.description: This is a pre-standardization implementation of Zigbee's RF testing standard. It utilizes the TIS (Total Isotropic Sensitivity)/ TRP (Total Radiated Power) testing interfaces and is optional for Zigbee certifications. This application adheres to the Zigbee RF Performance Test Spec v1.0.

descriptors.name: mp-ncp-spi
descriptors.label: Zigbee - NCP mp-ncp-spi
descriptors.description: The multi-PAN application provides support to form two personal area networks on same channel on single radio. This multi-PAN network coprocessor (NCP) application supports communication with a host application over a SPI interface. This NCP application can be built as configured, or optionally can be augmented with customized extensions for initialization, main loop processing, event definition/handling, and messaging with the host.

descriptors.name: mp-ncp-uart-hw
descriptors.label: Zigbee - NCP mp-ncp-uart-hw
descriptors.description: The multi-PAN application provides support to form two personal area networks on same channel on single radio. This multi-PAN network coprocessor (NCP) application supports communication with a host application over a UART interface with hardware flow control. This NCP application can be built as configured, or optionally can be augmented with customized extensions for initialization, main loop processing, event definition/handling, and messaging with the host.

descriptors.name: ncp-uart-hw-gp-multi-rail
descriptors.label: Zigbee - NCP ncp-uart-hw-gp-multi-rail
descriptors.description: This network co-processor (NCP) application uses the multiple RAIL demo component (multirail-demo), which uses the second RAIL handle to schedule a pre-configured outgoing Green Power device frame (GPDF) in response to an incoming bidirectional GPDF with its rx-after-tx bit set.

Device\ Type|NCP Project\ Difficulty|Advanced Wireless\ Technology|Zigbee

descriptors.name: ncp-uart-hw
descriptors.label: Zigbee - NCP ncp-uart-hw
descriptors.description: This network coprocessor (NCP) application supports communication with a host application over a UART interface with hardware flow control. This NCP application can be built as configured, or optionally can be augmented with customized extensions for initialization, main loop processing, event definition/handling, and messaging with the host. Steps to create a ECC enabled application for Smart Energy Profile application: 1) Download the side package 'EmberZnet-Smart-Energy.zip' 2) Extract the side package over installed SDK. 3) Enable 'CBKE 163k1' and/or 'CBKE 283k1' components depending on the use case. 4) Build the application.

descriptors.name: xncp-led-ncp
descriptors.label: Zigbee - NCP xncp-led-ncp
descriptors.description: An extensible network co-processor (xNCP) application with an LED controlled by a HOST.

descriptors.name: zigbeed
descriptors.label: Zigbee - Host zigbeed
descriptors.description: Zigbeed is a Zigbee Stack daemon that runs on a Linux host processor. It communicates with an 802.15.4 RCP via CPCd, and exposes an EZSP interface to a Zigbee host app. See AN1333 for more information.

properties.value: Capability|Multiprotocol Device\ Type|Host Project\ Difficulty|Beginner Wireless\ Technology|Zigbee
